title: Bridging visa A (BVA)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Bridging visa A (subclass 010), including what it allows, eligibility, conditions, validity rules, and how it interacts with substantive visa applications and judicial review processes. It also explains work permissions, when the visa comes into effect, when it ends, and who can be included in an application.

structured_data.description: This temporary visa generally allows a person to stay in Australia after their current substantive visa ceases and while their new substantive visa application is being processed.

key_updates.change: Applications for Bridging visa A (BVA), B (BVB), and C (BVC) can no longer be lodged in-person or via paper forms and must be submitted online through ImmiAccount or the online webform.

what_you_can_do: Stay lawfully in Australia until the substantive visa application is finally determined or, if granted in association with judicial review, until those proceedings are completed
Work if meeting requirements for work

additional_notes: Eligibility depends on meeting all requirements at the time of application.

automatic_application_notes: Nearly all bridging visas are applied for automatically when applying for a substantive visa.

A separate BVA application may be required if the substantive visa application did not constitute a BVA application, a previous BVA/BVB has ceased and requirements for another BVA are met, the applicant seeks a BVA without work restrictions, or the applicant has applied for judicial review.
methods: Online webform (required for judicial review-related BVA applications)

restrictions.travel: BVA does not permit return travel to Australia.

when_visa_comes_into_effect: When it is granted (if the substantive visa has already ceased or the BVA is more beneficial than the current bridging visa)
When the current substantive visa ceases
When a more beneficial bridging visa ceases

must_comply_with: Conditions imposed on the BVA when granted
Conditions of substantive visa if still in effect

if_work_not_allowed_or_restricted: Applicant may apply for another BVA that allows work
work_rights.assessment: Based on individual circumstances and the need to work.
cannot_be_granted_bva_with_work_rights_i: Current BVA prevents or restricts work and was granted because of a judicial review application
The applicant has applied for a protection visa

judicial_review_information.maintaining_lawful_status: A bridging visa is required to remain lawful during judicial review after a merits review tribunal upholds a refusal.

immediate_end: Leaving Australia while BVA is in effect
Grant of the substantive visa applied for
Grant of another bridging visa associated with the same substantive visa (e.g., BVB)
Cancellation of either the BVA or the substantive visa held at time of grant
other_end_conditions: Withdrawal of substantive visa application or review applications
Merit review tribunal declares no jurisdiction
when_bva_ends.checking_end_date: VEVO can be used to check exact stay period once an outcome is notified.

ceases_35_days_after: Refusal decision or AAT decision regarding associated substantive visa
Determination that substantive visa or AAT review application is invalid
Withdrawal of substantive visa application or AAT review application
ceases_28_days_after: Judicial review body upholds refusal of substantive visa

ceases_28_days_after_any_of: Notification that substantive visa application is invalid
Tribunal states it has no jurisdiction
Withdrawal of merits or judicial review application

stay_longer.instructions: Must apply for a new visa to stay longer

family_members.including_family_in_bva_application: Possible if they are included in the substantive visa application
family_members.assessment: Each family member is assessed individually to determine which bridging visa they can be granted

apply_from.location_requirement: Applicant and included family must be in Australia at both submission and grant

obligations: Comply with conditions of current visa
Comply with conditions of BVA once it comes into effect
